greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = Product_i prime(x_i)^k_i, then a(n) = Sum_i k_i * omega(x_i) - omega(n), where omega = A001221 is number of distinct prime factors.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(f=factor(n)); sum(k=1, #f~, f[k,2]*omega(primepi(f[k,1]))) - omega(n);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 09 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 24 2018
